td.content: s:pt presents with 3 months history of Body Aches. she is a 21 year old white F park ranger. o:Height 61 in, Weight 106 lbs, Temperature 99.1 F, Pulse 70, SystolicBP 111, DiastolicBP 74, Respiration 17, B burgdorferi IgM CSF positive a:Lyme Disease p:administered amoxicillin/calvulanate - 875 mg 2x day, performed B burgdorferi IgM CSF, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.

s:a f aged 22 Ys presents with moderate vomiting, mild vague postprandial epigastric pain x 7 weeks. patient also reports chronic moderate nausea. o:Height 61 in, Weight 104 lbs, Temperature 99 F, Pulse 70, SystolicBP 108, DiastolicBP 70, Respiration 16 a:Stomach Cancer p:performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed, and prescribed 5-FU - 1000 mg/m2 IV, cisplatin - 100 mg/m2 IV, and ordered EGD.

s:pt presents and denies vomiting, nausea and vague postprandial epigastric pain. pt is a 22 yr old female park ranger. o:Height 60 in, Weight 104 lbs, Temperature 98.9 F, Pulse 70, SystolicBP 107, DiastolicBP 69, Respiration 15, EGD shows esophagitis with a massive gastric ulcer extending from the inscura to the pylorus, no active bleeding was noted at the site a:Stomach Cancer p:performed EGD, and performed E/M Level 1 (new patient) - Completed.

s:a 23 year old white f park ranger presents with 3 years history of Body Aches. denies any smoking occasional EtOH o:Height 61 in, Weight 105 lbs, Temperature 98.6 F, Pulse 80, SystolicBP 113, DiastolicBP 74, Respiration 16, B burgdorferi IgM CSF positive a:Lyme Disease p:administered amoxicillin/calvulanate - 875 mg 2x day, performed B burgdorferi IgM CSF, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.

s:white f park ranger aged 23 Ys says she is having symptoms of moderate nausea 3 x week, mostly during the day. o:Height 61 in, Weight 104 lbs, Temperature 98.5 F, Pulse 79, SystolicBP 111, DiastolicBP 71, Respiration 16 a:Stomach Cancer p:performed E/M Level 3 (established patient) - Completed, and prescribed 5-FU - 1000 mg/m2 IV, cisplatin - 100 mg/m2 IV, and ordered EGD.

s:pt presents and denies nausea, vomiting and vague postprandial epigastric pain. pt is a F aged 23 yrs. o:, EGD shows esophagitis with a massive gastric ulcer extending from the inscura to the pylorus, no active bleeding was noted at the site a:Stomach Cancer p:performed EGD, and performed E/M Level 1 (established patient) - Completed.
